data.title: Arrived and left hungry
data.text:
Have you ever been soo hungry that when you get your food your soo disappointed you literally cry! 

Well this was me! I was soo hungry and soo upset tears just ran down my face. 

I ordered the spareribs and I got a black gob of the most disgusting looking goop I've ever seen, it killed all desire to eat! 

I tried to scrape it off and eat the ribs but after two bites I was done. I couldn't force one more bit down. I tried to eat the rice and chow main because I was soo hungry yet that too became a task. 

I should have ran out but instead I sat there quietly and waited for my husband to eat his food which seemed a lot better than the black, gob of "food" I got. 

Arrived and left hungry.

data.title: Don't miss the Great dining and drinking here
data.text: My wife and I were taken here by our friends (who we stayed with) as a treat and although I'm not much into Chinese food, my wife and friends are and I wasn't sure if there would be anything for me to try,but I need not have worried...I ordered the steak well done and Wow it was superb...cooked to perfection...In fact the whole experience for my wife and I was great and we enjoyed eating here very much..We have been several more times since and on one occasion just for drinks...they have the Strongest made drinks/mixers on offer anywhere in Yakima,so having a taxi is a must.*Hic*...but the food was the best experience for us and we shall continue coming here based on what meals we have had so far..

data.title: Historic...
data.text: If you want good authentic Chinese food, this is not the place.  But if are nostalgic for the 1950s American Chinese food experience, this is it.

data.title: Lunch with friends
data.text: Used to be the go to spot in Yakima for Chinese food. The food I ordered was awful. Sweet and sour spareribs sauce was bitter. Chow mien was over cooked and soggy. The salad dressing the Wheel was known for was brown and grainy. I will not return. Too bad. Used to be one of my favs.

data.title: Old Yakima Chinese food restaurant.
data.text: I went there last week to meet with friends and the food was mediocre at best! Old building, the waitress was vacuuming around us (I hate that when I'm eating). Yakima doesn't have a good Chinese Restaurant!

data.title: Terrible service ....
data.text: My sister and I went there for dinner and waited 20 mins just hot tea and ice water.... Which the ice water was warm not cold and the food was horrible found hair in my sister dinner and one in the fried rice in my niece's food gross.. And we told the manger she basicly tried to say we where liars that here kitchen staff where all bold ok whatever .. So my advise go somewhere else to eat....

data.title: Was not impressed
data.text: I went here one time, was shown to booth and waited 10 minutes for the waitress to even notice me.  She took my order and the food came it was not what I really expected.  I will never go again.

data.title: Quite possibly the worst  Chinese food ever
data.text: We took a stab at this place, understanding that it could be very terrible.  It was, so we weren't surprised, but we were shocked at just how bad it truly could be.  Even for Yakima this is really awful Chinese food - don't bother.

data.title: Family
data.text: Excellent family restaurant. The atmosphere, friendly service, large portions and prices that won't break your budget. The family style dinner was just hit the spot with a variety. The soup reminded the wife of home (Philippines). Menu also offers local beers and wines. We will be back.

data.title: Great Food
data.text:
Golden Wheel Restaurant Yakima Washington and Golden Wheel Restaurant Yakima Washington 9 S. 1st St. in Yakima Washington.

The exterior of this building looks like any Chinese restaurant in anywhere USA. However the interior has incredibly carved wood Dragon pillars and pagodas from the 40s to 50s era. It is a beautiful and well maintained in addition to being very clean. My wife and me ordered the Imperial dinner for two and was very pleased with all the entrées, and wonton soup. The sauces and spices for each entrée were unique from each other and were served hot. The dinner was so big that we took the remaining half back to the hotel and aided the next day as a meal. The service was friendly and fast and the cocktails were honest. It was a very great overall experience.

data.title: Mixed Reactions
data.text:
We came across the Golden Wheel while looking for a place to eat in downtown Yakima on a Saturday night.  Chinese food struck us as a good idea but one of us had a good dinner and the other was very disappointed with his meal. 

What we liked included a big display of interesting Chinese cultural items and a unique set of carved doors (look for the peekholes) at the entrance, dining in a restaurant established in 1937, the upholstery in the booths, the broccoli and chicken, O'Doul's was available, prices were reasonable, and water glasses were kept filled.  

What we didn't like: slow service, an error in our order although it was corrected right away, an overworked waitress, and the combination dinner ordered by my companion did not meet expectations.  There was no evidence of almonds in the almond chicken and it was covered with gravy.  The chow mein consisted of a few transparent rice noodles hidden under a pile of what looked like onions and celery. The rice was dry. We also overheard the waitress telling another table that the kitchen had run out of chicken.  

Perhaps it was just an "off" night. Lots of boxed leftovers were going out the door suggesting portions were too large but many diners thought the food was worth taking home.

data.title: Good Chinese
data.text: Food Good.  Service Good.  Restaurant dated and Dark.  Could use lighten up.  Owner and staff very pleasant.

data.title: Get Lotusized.
data.text:
When you grow weary of sampling Yakima Valley's wines, get thee to the Lotus Room.

My review isn't about the food (I didn't eat during this visit). This is about the experience of the lounge in the back of the restaurant called the Lotus Room.

They serve stiff drinks (you will get Lotusized) and has the best karaoke. It was packed full of locals, and we had a great time singing and laughing and people watching. If you want a fine dining atmosphere, this ain't it. But if you want to hang with some salt of the earth people and have a great time doing so, you'll love the energy and atmosphere of the Lotus Room.

data.title: I really can't believe the other reviews.
data.text: I went to the Golden wheel as a back up because the restaurant I wanted to go to was packed. What a mistake that was.. As you walk in, the dirty floors jump at you then the childish at best decor slaps you in the face. The candy for sale at the front register should have been a good indicator that disappointment was soon to come. Though the staff was very polite, that's about where the compliments end. We were sat in a very old, unkempt booth, to dated place settings. I don't claim to be an expert in cuisine, but the selection was odd at best. My order of fried prawns was a disaster. About 9 lbs of batter and about 3 oz of shrimp, then, to top it off, it was served with a house salad and French fries..? Not the combo I would have picked. Needless to say, my experiences there was unpleasant and unfullfilling. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Strange hours, great food
data.text:
My wife and I visited the Golden Wheel a few weeks ago and the food was excellent.  They have the best chinese hot mustard I have ever had and are the best Chinese food restuarant in town.
Having lived in Seattle for years, I was used to amazing chinese food, but the selection in Yakima is pretty limited.  We prefer the Golden Wheel to other chinese restaurants in Yakima.
Last time we went, we had the bbq pork appetizer, and I had the pork chow mein (excellent), almond chicken and sweet and sour chicken.  My wife had the egg roll (excellent), almond chicken and sweet and sour chicken combo.  The Golden Wheel serves good chinese food on a consistant basis, even though they have strange hours.  We have gone around 2pm several times to find that they didn't open until 4pm on weekends and mondays.
Overall, it is the best chinese food in Yakima in our opinion, and they serve solid mixed drinks that are known throughout town as the strongest mixed drinks in the valley.

data.title: Good  Service but Poor Food
data.text: Tried a soup and combination dinner while passing through Yakima and was quite disappointed.  The Chow Mein bore no resemblance to any I have had elsewhere and consisted mostly of stir-fried sliced onions with a few dime-sized pieces of chicken layered on top.  The batter on the fried prawns was so thick I peeled it all off to be able to taste the prawns.  The sweet and sour ribs came with a dark brow sweet sauce that was a thick version of pancake syrup leaving only the taste of sugar.  This is not good Chinese by any streatch of the imagination.

data.title: Happy Hour
data.text: This is the place to go if you want happy hour drinks. They know how to pour em here. Just don't eat the food.

data.title: Amazing place for food AND drinks!
data.text: I absolutely love this place.. We like to go there on a weekday for the relaxed atmosphere and then we sit up in the bar for Karaoke on the weekends where it's usually packed!  Every time I go in there we're treated like family, they remember your name and what you ordered last time.. I really enjoy the staff there.   Beyond the staff their food is delicious, always hot, and it gets me full every time.. And their drinks.. I don't even have to MENTION how amazing their drinks are..  Beats the socks off the other Chinese restaurants in town!!!

data.title: Tried. Alot
data.text:
I been in most of the Asian food places.
And golden wheel always have best service.
Never had cold food or hair in it not going to mention any place.
I love this place cause the price is right.
If you like it very very spicey they will makeit that way. Don't like a item they will substitute.  The tea is always good.
Want a drink they know how.
Few other places I don't. Get same service...

data.title: I think this restaurant is great.
data.text: We always have great meals here and they never add MSG which is a big plus for me.  Our regular server is always attentive and friendly.  I have had several dishes on the menu and have never been disappointed.  Frankly, I'm surprised by the other comments as I really like their wonton soup.  Maybe they miss the MSG.
